workflow.name: Automate Jira backlog hygiene and reporting with Slack, Gmail and GPT-4
workflow.description:
## Description
Automate Jira backlog management with intelligent cleanup, prioritization, and AI-powered reporting. This workflow scans daily to identify stale issues, missing priorities, and overdue tasks ‚Äî auto-updates Jira with corrective labels, logs everything into Google Sheets for tracking, and notifies teams via Slack. Every Friday, it sends an AI-generated backlog summary email to project leads for visibility and planning. üöÄüìÖ

## What This Template Does
- Step 1: Triggers automatically every weekday at 7:00 AM to fetch backlog issues from Jira. ‚è∞
- Step 2: Filters issues missing estimates, assignees, or priority values for cleanup. üßπ
- Step 3: Applies corrective labels (e.g., ‚ÄúNeeds Estimation,‚Äù ‚ÄúUnassigned,‚Äù ‚ÄúOverdue‚Äù). üè∑Ô∏è
- Step 4: Logs all flagged issues into Google Sheets with timestamps for audit tracking. üìä
- Step 5: Sends real-time Slack alerts summarizing key backlog insights. üí¨
- Step 6: Every Friday, uses GPT-4 to generate a summarized backlog health report. ü§ñ
- Step 7: Delivers weekly summary emails to leads and project managers via Gmail. üìß

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Eliminates manual backlog reviews and prioritization.
 ‚úÖ Ensures consistent Jira hygiene and task visibility.
 ‚úÖ Provides centralized backlog tracking via Google Sheets.
 ‚úÖ Sends real-time alerts for overdue and unassigned tasks.
 ‚úÖ Offers AI-driven insights for better sprint planning.

## Features
- Automated daily trigger (Mon‚ÄìFri, 7 AM)
- Jira issue fetching and filtering by priority and assignment
- Smart labeling for hygiene tracking
- Slack alerts for backlog anomalies
- Weekly GPT-4 generated summary reporting
- Google Sheets integration for historical logging
- Gmail integration for summary email delivery

## Requirements
- Jira API credentials with read/write issue permissions
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials for data logging
- Slack Bot token with chat:write permissions
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials for email delivery
- OpenAI or Azure OpenAI API key for GPT-4 summarization

## Target Audience
- Agile and Scrum teams maintaining large backlogs üß©
- Product managers ensuring backlog quality and consistency üìã
- Engineering leads seeking proactive backlog hygiene üõ†Ô∏è
- Organizations needing visibility across project tasks üè¢
- Remote teams using Slack for daily syncs üåê

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Connect Jira credentials and specify your project key(s). üîë
- Link your Google Sheet and replace YOUR_SHEET_ID for backlog tracking. üìä
- Configure Slack and replace YOUR_CHANNEL_ID for alert delivery. üí¨
- Add Gmail credentials and define recipient emails for weekly reports. üìß
- Add your GPT-4 API key (OpenAI or Azure) for AI summarization. ü§ñ
- Adjust cron expression (0 7 * * 1-5) to match your local timezone. ‚è∞
- Run manually once to validate all connections, then enable automation. ‚úÖ

workflow.name: Automate Jira Backlog Hygiene and Reporting with Slack ,Gmail and AI

parameters.content:
## üéØ Backlog Hygiene & Auto-Grooming

Automated Jira backlog management that identifies issues, takes corrective actions, and generates AI-powered reports.

**What it does:**
- Runs weekdays at 9 AM to analyze backlog items
- Identifies overdue tasks and missing priorities
- Auto-tags issues needing attention
- Logs all backlog items to Google Sheets
- Sends real-time Slack alerts for critical issues
- Generates AI-powered weekly digest emails

**Use Case:** Perfect for engineering teams maintaining clean, prioritized Jira backlogs with minimal manual effort.

**Required Setup:**
- Jira Software Cloud credentials
- Google Sheets for audit trail
- Slack workspace for alerts
- Gmail for email digests
- Azure OpenAI API for AI summaries

## ‚è∞ Weekday Mornings

Runs Mon-Fri at 9:00 AM to groom backlog.

**Schedule:** `0 9 * * 1-5`
**Timing:** Daily at 09:00 on weekdays

options.jql: project = YOUR_PROJECT_KEY AND status in ("Backlog") ORDER BY created DESC

parameters.content:
## üìã Fetch Backlog Items

**Setup Required:**
1. Replace `YOUR_PROJECT_KEY` with your Jira project key
2. Connect Jira credentials

**Fetches:** All issues in "Backlog" status, ordered by creation date (newest first)

## üîÑ Field Extraction

Maps Jira fields to clean, usable data.

**Extracted Fields:**
- ID, Key, Status, Summary
- Created & Last Updated dates
- Assignee & Creator email
- Due Date & Priority

**Note:** Uses safe null handling with fallbacks

## üìä Audit Trail

**Setup Required:**
1. Replace `YOUR_SHEET_ID` with Google Sheets document ID
2. Connect Google OAuth2 credentials

**Logs:** All backlog items with timestamps for historical tracking and reporting

## ‚è∞ Overdue Filter

**Logic:** Checks if Due Date is before today

**True Branch:** Overdue tasks
- Sends Jira notification
- Posts Slack alert

**False Branch:** Not overdue
- Continues to priority check

additionalFields.subject: Overdue Task: {{ $json.Summary }}
additionalFields.textBody: This issue is overdue and requires immediate attention. Please review and update the status or due date.

parameters.content:
## üìß Jira Notification

**Setup Required:**
1. Uses same Jira credentials
2. Removed hardcoded user/group IDs

**Sends:** In-app Jira notification to reporter and assignee for overdue tasks

## üí¨ Slack - Overdue

**Setup Required:**
1. Replace `YOUR_CHANNEL_ID` with Slack channel ID
2. Connect Slack API credentials

**Posts:** Real-time alert for overdue items with full context

## üè∑Ô∏è Priority Check

**Logic:** Checks if Priority field is empty

**True Branch:** Missing priority
- Tags issue with "Needs-Priority" label
- Posts Slack alert

**False Branch:** Priority exists
- No action needed

## üè∑Ô∏è Auto-Tag Issue

**Setup Required:**
1. Uses same Jira credentials

**Action:** Automatically adds "Needs-Priority" label to issues missing priority field for easy filtering

## üí¨ Slack - Priority

**Setup Required:**
1. Use same Slack channel ID and credentials

**Posts:** Alert for issues missing priority with action taken (tagged with label)

## üì¶ Combine Data

Aggregates all backlog items into single payload for AI analysis.

**Purpose:** Prepares comprehensive dataset for AI to analyze patterns and generate insights

parameters.text:
=Analyze the following Jira backlog items and generate an email for the project manager.

Each item includes: issue ID, key, assignee, status, due date, priority, and summary.

Your goal:
- Identify overdue tasks (due date before today).
- Highlight items with missing priority.
- Summarize the overall backlog health.
- Suggest 2-3 actionable steps to improve backlog hygiene.
- Mention how many issues fall into each category.

Backlog data:
{{ JSON.stringify($json) }}

options.systemMessage:
You are an automation assistant for project management and engineering teams. Your role is to analyze Jira backlog data and generate a professional HTML email for a project or engineering manager that summarizes the backlog health and highlights key actions. Output Requirements: - The output must be a valid JSON object with two keys: { "Subject": "", "Body": "" } Formatting & Tone Guidelines: - Maintain a clear, concise, and professional business tone. - Use semantic HTML tags such as

,

    ,
  • , , , and for readability. - Do not include any Markdown or code formatting. - The HTML should be visually structured and ready to send directly via email. - Always start with a short greeting (e.g., "Dear Project Manager,"). - Follow with a summary paragraph that states the purpose of the email (e.g., "Here's the latest Jira backlog summary for this week."). - Include clearly formatted sections for: 1. Overdue Tasks 2. Missing Priorities 3. General Backlog Health - Add an HTML table if helpful for listing issue details (Key, Summary, Assignee, Due Date, Priority). - End the email with an "Actionable Recommendations" section listing 2-3 clear next steps. - Close politely (e.g., "Regards, Backlog Hygiene Assistant"). - Keep the email content under 300 words. Behavior: - Analyze patterns and highlight areas needing attention. - Summarize counts of overdue, missing priority, or stale issues. - Suggest actionable next steps to improve backlog hygiene. - The output must be clean, valid JSON and contain no Markdown or triple backticks.

parameters.content:
## ü§ñ AI Analysis Engine

**What it does:**
- Analyzes all backlog items using AI
- Identifies patterns and trends
- Generates structured JSON output with Subject and HTML Body

**Requires:** Azure OpenAI credentials and structured output parser

## üîó AI Model Config

**Setup Required:**
1. Replace credential ID with your Azure OpenAI credentials
2. Model: gpt-4o-mini (cost-effective)

**Connects:** To AI agent for language processing

## üìã Output Parser

Ensures AI returns valid JSON with:
- Subject: Email subject line
- Body: HTML formatted email

**No setup required** - connects to AI agent automatically

## üìß Send AI Digest

**Setup Required:**
1. Replace `YOUR_EMAIL@example.com` with manager's email
2. Connect Gmail OAuth2 credentials

**Sends:** AI-generated HTML email with backlog summary and actionable recommendations

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
